item.title: Internet of Things
item.description:
Internet of Things

Why all the fuss suddenly?

item.title: S7th heaven
item.description:
S7th heaven

Even better to hold and behold

Although details of the devices were widely leaked ahead of the official unveiling by the company's Mobile chief DJ Koh, they didn't do justice to just how great the two flagship projects look and feel in the flesh - or should that be glass and steel?

item.title: Lost in cyberspace
item.description:
Lost in cyberspace

Be suspicious of unsolicited emails

Pop quiz time. Who was the first African in space?

item.title: A world of mobile marvels
item.description:
A world of mobile marvels

In a recent  column I shared my first impressions of Samsung’s gorgeous Galaxy S7 and S7 Edge smartphones following their unveiling at the start of Mobile World Congress (MWC) in Barcelona.

Wouldn't it be great to run a global business that is so successful you are willing to risk alienating a huge slice of your existing and potential customers - six million of them in South Africa alone?

item.title: King of convertibles?
item.description:
King of convertibles?

Watch out Surface Pro and iPad Pro. Huawei's Matebook may just be the best convertible yet

Tablet PCs are increasingly popular among business people who like to stay productive while they’re on the move.

item.title: Explore the skies with this new USS Enterprise drone
item.description:
Explore the skies with this new USS Enterprise drone

Spin Master is probably best known for its line of Air Hogs RC vehicles, but the company also has prior experience with recreating fictional spacecraft in drone form. Last year's Star Wars "Force Friday" event brought us a quadcopter Millennium Falcon and X-wing starfighter. The USS Enterprise shows the same level of care in its design.

item.title: A Blade Runner 2 release date has finally been announced
item.description:
A Blade Runner 2 release date has finally been announced

This is not a drill: Blade Runner 2 finally has a release date. Warner Bros. has scheduled the long-awaited sequel to the 1982 Ridley Scott-helmed cult hit for a January 2018 opening, reports THR. Harrison Ford will return to star in the follow-up film, joined by Ryan Gosling.

item.title: By George, Han DID shoot first
item.description:
By George, Han DID shoot first

If there's still anyone you know who believes the alien thug Greedo fired first in the original (subsequently sanatised) version of the cantina scene of Star Wars Episode IV, point them to this recently surfaced version of the movie.

item.title: Telkom: What customer care? - a follow-up
item.description:
Telkom: What customer care? - a follow-up

A few weeks back in my column in the Sunday Tribune I reported on how longstanding frustrations over Telkom's poor customer care had culminated in an online petition aimed at getting the communications parastatal to sort out the mess once and for all.
